data: Step 1:  VTE prophylaxis may not be indicated when:

- Expected length of stay less than 24 hours.  Reassess if length of stay is extended beyond 24 hours
 - Already receiving anticoagulation therapy
No anticoagulant or no mechanical prophylaxis required

Prophylactic anticoagulants contraindicated in:   
- High risk of serious bleeding or bleeding into a critical site (e.g. intracranial, epidural, pericardial, intraocular, retroperitoneal, intra-articular)    
- Active bleeding of clinical significance requiring intervention     
- Uncontrolled systolic hypertension of 180 mmHg or higher  
- Platelet count less than 50 x 10^9/L (consider Hematology consult)    
- Known major bleeding disorder or acquired coagulopathy (such as due to acute liver failure)   
- Lumbar puncture/epidural/spinal anesthesia expected within next 12 hours 
- Lumbar puncture/epidural/spinal anesthesia received in previous 4 hours  
- History of heparin induced thrombocytopenia (HIT) (consider Hematology consult)  
- History of hypersensitivity to LMWH or unfractionated heparin (consider Hematology consult)
Reassess daily to start pharmacologic prophylaxis if contraindication resolves
Contraindication: Risk of Serious Bleed in Critical Site
Contraindication: Uncontrolled Systolic Hypertension of 180 mmHg or Higher
Contraindication: Platelet Count Less Than 50 x 10^9/L
Contraindication: Lumbar Puncture/Epidural/Spinal Anesthesia Expected Within Next 12 Hours
Contraindication: Lumbar Puncture/Epidural/Spinal Anesthesia Received in Previous 4 Hours
Contraindication: Hx of heparin-induced thrombocytopenia, DO NOT give LMWH or heparin
Step 3: Provide VTE prophylaxis for patients who do not meet criteria in Step 1 or 2
